title: Create 'Chapter One' online bookstore homepage UI with trending books and cart

requirements.text: Implement a React + TypeScript homepage that matches the provided HTML structure: header with logo text ‚ÄúChapter One üìö‚Äù, navigation links (Home, Categories, Bestsellers), and a cart button showing item count.

acceptanceCriteria: Header contains the logo text and the four nav items.
Cart label displays a dynamic count (not hard-coded) based on current cart state.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Create the hero section with the provided headline, description, and CTA button text, styled for a modern storefront landing page.

quotes:
Find Your Next Great Escape

From timeless classics to modern thrillers, we have it all.

acceptanceCriteria: Hero shows the exact headline, description, and CTA text from the provided HTML.
CTA button is visually prominent and has hover/focus styles.

acceptanceCriteria: Trending Books section displays the 4 books: The Great Gatsby, 1984, To Kill a Mockingbird, The Alchemist.
Each card shows: cover image, title, author, and an Add to Cart button.
Grid is responsive (1 column on small screens, increasing columns on wider screens).

requirements.text: Implement client-side cart behavior: clicking ‚ÄúAdd to Cart‚Äù increases the cart count in the header; optionally allow removing items from a simple cart drawer/modal or dedicated cart section accessible from the cart button.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking Add to Cart updates the header cart count immediately.
Cart state persists at least for the current session (page not refreshed).
Cart button provides a way to view what was added (drawer/modal/section) and adjust quantities or remove items.

requirements.text: Add the footer with the provided copyright text.

quotes: © 2024 Chapter One Bookstore. All rights reserved.

acceptanceCriteria: Footer displays: ‚Äú¬© 2024 Chapter One Bookstore. All rights reserved.‚Äù

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) inspired by a warm, paper-and-ink bookstore aesthetic, using Tailwind CSS consistently across the page (avoid a blue/purple primary palette).
acceptanceCriteria: Theme feels consistent across header, hero, cards, buttons, and footer.
Primary colors are not blue/purple-based; use a warm bookstore palette (e.g., parchment/cream, ink/dark, accent like burgundy/forest).
Typography and spacing are consistent and readable.

requirements.text: Add the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the homepage (hero background and book cover placeholders).
acceptanceCriteria: All required images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
Hero section uses the generated hero image as a background or prominent visual.
Each trending book card displays a corresponding generated cover placeholder image (not plain text 'Cover Art').

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other paths listed as immutable by the platform.
Do not introduce non-supported frameworks or services (keep to React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query; Motoko backend optional).
nonGoals: Implementing a full product catalog backend with search, filtering, pagination, or admin CRUD.
Adding third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is allowed, and it is not required for this homepage).
